alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 6:48PM CDT until August 07 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following county, Cumberland. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 648 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Crossville, Fairfield Glade, Crab Orchard, Pleasant Hill, Slate Springs, Cumberland Mountain State Park and Lake Tansi. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
